column4: where can i see in linux what kind of processor is on a workstation?
thx! it shows me the right model...but only 800MHZ
thx! it shows me the right model...but only 800MHZ!?
that's fine, it means that speedstep or powernow has scaled down your frequency
it will go up on demand.
but why..it isn't running on battery right now
to reduce heat output and extend the life of your hardware.
how nice it is to me that ubuntu:) it cares about my hardware;)
you can add the CPU Frequency Monitor applet to the panel and watch the frequency going up and down as you load your CPU
is it stuck at a reduced frequency?
can you give an example of what's slow?
opening apps for example. this takes simply to long. changing between apps and windows is slow as hell too
could your hard drive be failing?
